forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 54. West wind around 9 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 5 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
In the hush of early morning, Downtown San Francisco stirs under a blanket of clarity, the night’s tranquil darkness fading as the horizon hints at the warmth of a new day. While the air carries with it a gentle coolness of 54 degrees, a steady west wind whispers through the streets at nearly 9 mph, promising a lively infusion of energy as the sun rises. By midday, the city is set to embrace a sunny disposition, with temperatures reaching a comforting 70 degrees before softly receding to 67 by afternoon. Gusts that could touch 28 mph may ruffle the edges of your garments, a lively reminder of the Pacific’s influence over this vibrant landscape.

As the sun ascends, it will reveal a scene devoid of fog, the marine layer staying at bay, allowing the Golden Gate and the skyline to stand proudly against the azure sky. This clarity invites one to don light layers—a breathable shirt or a light jacket in hand, perhaps, for the moments spent outside when the breeze picks up. It’s a perfect day to wander among the cafés, savoring artisanal pastries while observing the steady flow of locals and tourists alike. Those inspired may choose to stroll along the waterfront, absorbing the radiant warmth of the sun as sailboats dot the horizon, a picture of leisurely activity and joy in the heart of the city.
